result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel W Byrd

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:00 pm case called and held via Zoom. Defendant Daniel W Byrd appeared by video.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Daniel W Byrd.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- received by the Court. 
There is an offer from the State- Defense requests a STC in 30-60 days. 
A status conference is scheduled for 11/30/22 at 1:30 pm (via Zoom).
Adding Count 2- Operating with PAC (4th Offense)

9:48 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel W Byrd in court.  Attorney Brian William Severson in court for Daniel W Byrd. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Case is referred to Judge Barna to schedule an ARGN.
Dated 08/11/2022, Request by Attorney Brian Severson to Rescind Order for Specific Judicial Assignment

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

(11:09 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel W Byrd appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Rachel Allison Robole appeared by video for Daniel W Byrd. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on July 18, 2022 at 3 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
